title: Playboy model caught with cocaine, ice and fantasy tries to blame bikie ex
text:
A former Playboy model caught with drugs during a traffic stop has tried to blame her bikie ex-boyfriend for getting her involved in using illicit substances.

Azzra Hughes, who now works as a model and high-end private waitress, walked away from court on Tuesday with a $1000 fine after being caught with ice, cocaine, and fantasy.

Police had been targeting Ms Hughes' white Range Rover after they received intelligence the car was being used for drug supply, the court was told, according to The Gold Coast Bulletin.

A former Playboy model caught with drugs during a traffic stop has tried to blame her bikie ex-boyfriend for getting her involved in using the illicit substances

Azzra Hughes, who now works as a model and high-end private waitress, walked away from court on Tuesday with a $1000 fine after being caught with ice, cocaine, and fantasy

The car was stopped by officers on July 3 just after 9pm at Helensavle on the Gold Coast where they conducted a roadside drug test.

The test returned a negative result but, based on the intelligence, the officers searched the vehicle.

The search found in the driver's side door 0.71g of ice and 0.811g of cocaine.

1.35g of the drug fantasy was also found in multiple vials inside the car.

Her defence lawyer, Campbell MacCallum, attributed Hughes becoming involved in drugs due to the influence of an ex-boyfriend.

After a previous appearance in court for drugs last year, Hughes travelled overseas to Canada and London where she worked as a model.

When she returned to the Gold Coast, her lawyer said she began a relationship with a man who introduced her to cocaine and fantasy.

'Thankfully that relationship has ended. It would seem the target of this particular operation was (her former partner) as the primary target,' he said.

Hughes pleaded guilty to five charges including possession of dangerous drugs.

Magistrate Kay Philipson fined Hughes $1000 - taking into account she was three weeks into a drug rehabilitation program.

Hughes had no conviction recorded.
description: A former Playboy model caught with drugs during a traffic stop on the Gold Coast has tried to blame her bikie ex-boyfriend for getting her involved in using the illicit substances.
authors: Brett Lackey For Daily Mail Australia
